comments.commentBody:
We've already established that, John.

Movie title?

It's not about the transgressions or forgiveness. Is the talent pool so thin that these guys even have a chance of getting back in to government? Why doesn't bad judgement disqualify a candidate for office? It's appalling.

You are right about a Weiner/Spitzer administration. Both are damaged by scandal. When discovered Weiner lied and tried to cover up and cling to office. Spitzer acknowledged blame, appoligized to his wife and family and immediately resigned from office. In public office Spitzer was competent and relentless in pursuing the public interest while Weiner had little or no influence, was not marked as a leader in the party and was marked by fiery political speeches and ambition for higher office. No matter who is mayor if Spitzer is comptroller he would be that person to prevent disaster.

I believe in forgiveness and second chances in sex scandals except where force or workplace influence is involved. Some things I do not forgive: theft, as we are seeing in Virginia, bribe taking, betrayal of the public trust. No second chances for that. But once a sex scandal breaks and reporters are asking questions, differences in people’s character show as they did between Spitzer whose was quick and honorable and Weiner which was not. Of course Weiner’s transgression was so tacky, as was his explanation. He hit the send button in error. When I get in the voting booth to send someone to Gracy Mansion, there are 2 that I will not push the send button for and Weiner is one and the other also is a big mouth hot tempered screamer.

No, it's because whites still have recourse in the voting booth.

The castration of the VRA by the Supreme Court reminds us that the establishment would deny black folks a full voice from the get-go.

The verdict against Trayvon Martin is already in. He's dead. I'd say that's an unfavorable verdict.

In my neck of the woods Zimmerman doesn't have enough supporters to organize a one car parade. BTW, white people don't riot. They don't have to. The laws are overwhelmingly stacked in their favor.

This is absurd. No one has the right to shoot an unarmed person just because they're losing the fight. Thats the cowards way out. As a whiteman whose family includes John Adams, I find this statement to be the height of racism. Flipping it around does not make it equivalent.

This presumes only a verdict unfavorable to Trayvon Martin could produce rioting. That is the same sort of assumption challenged in the text.

Zimmerman has many supporters too, and too many have been all but foaming at the mouth over this. Why assume they wouldn't riot? Is it because they are presumed to be white?

Please! My daughter has had two MRI brain scans. The first was for the purpose of diagnosis, and the second, a more involved kind, was as a research participant. She is fine.

And my dog took DES for several years at the end of her life. She died of kidney failure, not the effects of DES. Medications and procedures used appropriately are safe enough for many of us.

Today's cell phone may be tomorrow's DES too, but for now, as best we can tell, it's safe. So we use them.
I used to have a plan for my old age.  I planned not to live long enough to have one, but here I am in my eighties.  Guess I'll have to change my plans.

Your son is lucky.

How about the students who are working their way through college or are on their own? My campus is full of first-generation college students who work and go to school, in addition to students whose parents don't want them to be there, and thus are not putting in long hours to pay for their education.

Students are supposed to be focused on what they're doing at school, not working 20-40hr weeks at a menial job that pays minimum wage. It's a job to BE a student, where once you're out of the classroom you should be devoting time going over material/homework/research etc. This is why we take out loans, so we get a solid education so we don't have to worry about paying it off when we get out. It'd be nice we aren't hit with fees on top of the rising cost of tuition.

I don't see people with resentment directed at the poor or unemployed but, I do at the young and government.

The young because unlike us baby boomers we would work starting at a young age doing jobs like lawn mowing or pick oranges etc and todays youth feel they are too good for hard work.

The government just wants to make people lazy and dependent on government so they can build their voter base.

Corporations control the government via K Street Lobbyist. Those who retire from government or do not get re-elected turn into Lobbyist.

Until K Street is shut down and there is Tax Reform that prevents lobbyist from writing our tax code, then things are not going to change.

You're missing the point.  Wall St banks are getting money from government at a fraction of 1%.  They're taking that money and "investing" it in the stock market, inflating stock prices to boost their asset values, so they can borrow even more.  But that's acceptable to you, I guess.  No place in our government to be giving out handouts to the underserving.
These senators are dunderheads. Let's cap their health benefits and salaries.

They should all stop going to college for 2-3 years and you can be guaranteed the cost would go down.

Of course, once this bubble burst, that is exactly what is going to happen anyways but, until then these colleges are going to milk the system for as much as they can.

I don't know about all states but Montana subsidizes state colleges through property taxes. When I went to college here in the 70's tuition was around $10/credit hour. The state tax subsidy is much less now and the costs are at least $100/credit hour. Maybe twice that. Yet our politicians continue to give away our state's natural resources like natural gas, oil, and coal to any corporation that wants them.

Gasoline cost .35-.50/gal in the early 70's. It's now 3.50-4.00/gal yet the minimal royalties paid for gas, oil, and coal extraction is the same. As much as we joke about North Dakota at least they are taxing the extraction companies a lot more. They haven't helped their citizens with money much yet and likely will give most of it away to the wealthy in other tax breaks. But at least they have it.

An educated public questions authority and corrupt behavior of our less than sterling politicians. That is why higher education is becoming less and less available to Americans, unless of course you belong to the moneyed class. Shame, Shame America you are turning into a 3rd world country.

Without access to higher education the middle class will keep shrinking.

We will have a 2 tiered system - the poor and the wealthy.
I know.  And we have $50 billion for more border fence and border agents.  We always have money for defense, wars, spying.

This issue reeks with politics. Obama has offered a plan that Harry Reid rejected.

He wants to kick the can down the road by putting off the decision for another year. I wonder where he gets that from") Students are deep in debt and face a bleak future in the job market that will allow them to pay the debt off. The default rate is climbing. The challenge is to make the education system affordable.

The best thing for students to learn is that "there is no such thing as a free lunch". Encouraging debt that is government guaranteed will encourage default. the liberal attitude is "let the government pay for it". Can you imagine any politician putting teeth in any policy that forces students to repay loans?

Unfortunately it is better for students to pay the price now and demand that congress come up with a solution that resolves the problem (that is far more than interest rates). This will be a good issue for the 2014 election.

Jim,

Republicans have taken the tact instead of pandering to their monied donors, akin to political prostitution or legalized bribery.

The Koch brothers and other billionaires and corporations write the self-serving economic platform for the party and cobble together a disparate coalition of religious zealots, anti-science, misogynistic, homophobic, redneck bigots to carry elections.

They could care a whit about the middle class, even less about the poor, sick or aged.

Loans provide less affluent families with access to higher education and with it social mobility. There is absolutely no reason for the cost of educational loans to exceed the government's cost of borrowing. At present rates there is a negative subsidy.

Banks have unlimited access to funds at the Fed Funds rate, which is near zero, homeowners receive subsidized and tax deductible mortgage rates near 4% while students pay 6.8% for a debt that can never be discharged.

Republicans care only about protecting the status quo, and upward mobility with a well educated populace disturbs that. They would rather have a nice pool of unemployed workers to keep wages down and profit margins up.

It is no coincidence that all the Voter ID laws trying to suppress the vote allow military IDs but purposely exempt college IDs as proof to vote.
One of many plans--and not just about education.  But this stinks.
Thats what I been saying for the longest but the majority of people are so indoctrinated that they fail to see what's going on.
This is clearly a designed plan by the moneyed elites to make attending college more difficult for poor and middle-class Americans.
There's a reason why student loan interest rates ought to be higher.  Cars and homes are tangible items that can be repossessed.
That warren bill was an immature gimmick that only goes to show how little she understands about the financial industry

Why is it "fair" that you and I have to cover their defaults as taxpayers when the students can't pay the loan back? Why is it "fair" that the the schools who benefit from the easy money don't have any requirement to pay back the excess money"

46% of members of Congress are millionaires. In 2010, the average net worth of a US senator was $2.56 million.

Still wonder why they don't see the student loan issue as a problem?

"Why is it 'fair' that you and I have to cover their defaults as taxpayers when the students can't pay the loan back?"

Maybe a lower interest rate on their loan would make them less likely to default.

How defaults are handled and where to peg the interest rate are two separate and distinct issues.
Don't these guys and gals have kids of their own? Why should our kids who want to go to college and graduate school be penalized for wanting to get a decent education? It's not fair.
So true! Even in our solidly democrat state of MA, many local town reps are Republicans.
We've been taken in by a flim flam man
seven out of ten richest senators are democrats.. or better way to call them “republicans in democratic skin”, who made fortune by selling socialist ideas to the people..
What on earth is wrong with those Democrats? What could they possibly be thinking? It's bad politics and horrible policy. I repeat, what's wrong with those people?

Not an issue that requires compromise? What about the gay community. Why should their tax dollars go to education when they have no children?

You have made this all about YOU and what's in your best interest!

As long as government provides the loans, rates will keep going up.
No competition for the dollars. Uncle Sam has it all covered and the
Universities want it all!

Of course someone (many someone's) helped your son get through university. You can figure this out. No one gets where they are, alone. That attitude of "I received not one single hand of help" is a demonstration of a lack of critical thinking skills.

Public schools? Small business tax breaks? Think about it.

They should let people 55 an older retire on SS and open up more jobs for the younger generation but, I'm sure that if they did that, the corporations wouldn't hire Americans, they would want more H1B Visa's to hire cheaper labor.

So, what is this expensive education going to get you these days?
